Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Apidaecin II (natural AMPs; Pro-rich; PrAMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals)

Literature Information.Literature: Rich in P.Activity: active against A. tumefaciens DSM 3129 (MIC 0.2 ug/ml), E. salicis NCPPB 2530 (MIC 0.02 ug/ml), E. coli NCTC 9001 (MIC 0.1 ug/ml), P. syringae pv. tomamta NCPPB 1105 (MIC 0.1 ug/ml), R. meliloti ZB 314 (MIC 0.02 ug/ml), S. Newport CD 94 (MIC 0.2 ug/ml), S. typhimurium ATCC 23565 (MIC 0.1 ug/ml), S.marcescens ATCC 17991 (MIC >200 ug/ml), S. flexneri CP 87 (MIC 0.1 ug/ml), C. insidiosum NCPPB 1109 (MIC 100 ug/ml), B.alvei LMG 6922 (MIC > 200 ug/ml), B. megaterium OMB 1551 (MIC 100 ug/ml), B.subtilis NRRL-B-237 (MIC >200 ug/ml), and B.thuringiensis tenebrionis DSM 2803 (MIC >200 ug/ml).  Updated 7/2014; 7/2021;; 9/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Casteels P, Ampe C, Jacobs F, Vaeck M, Tempst P1989
Literature Information.Title: Apidaecins: antibacterial peptides from honeybees.
